events.summary: Former Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte is facing trial in The Hague for his unprecedented "war on drugs," which has killed thousands. Meanwhile, in the Philippines, the war on drugs continues.

events.title: Will 'El Mencho's' death trigger a new drug war in Mexico?
events.summary: With the killing of "El Mencho," the Mexican government seems to have ended its truce with the country's drug cartels. Who was the drug boss, and what is the Jalisco New Generation Cartel, or CJNG?

events.title: France's Macron accepts resignation of Louvre director after October jewel heist
events.summary: French President Macron has accepted the resignation of the director of the Louvre Museum. Laurence des Cars was under fire ever since robbers stole priceless jewelry from the world-famous museum last year.

events.title: US lawmakers find Nigeria 'deadliest' place for Christians
events.summary: US lawmakers release a report on their findings into alleged persecution of Christians in Nigeria. It comes after President Donald Trump categorized the African nation as a "country of particular concern" last year.

events.title: How two directors fought back when their film was stolen
events.summary: "Butty" became "T-130": An American submitted a movie by two German film students to film festivals under his own name and won prizes. The duo dealt with the matter in an unusual way.

events.title: Clashes spark safety concerns for World Cup in Mexico
events.summary: A wave of violence set off by the killing of a Mexican drug cartel boss has raised concerns about security ahead of the World Cup. So far there is no plan to move the 13 matches scheduled in Mexico.

events.title: Hungary, Slovakia spar with Ukraine over Druzhba pipeline
events.summary: The Druzhba serves as the primary conduit for Russian crude deliveries to Hungary and Slovakia. Shipments through the pipeline have stalled since the end of January.

events.title: US plan to pull forces from Okinawa tested by China's rise
events.summary: For many years, the US has been planning to reduce its footprint in southern Japan and move thousands of marines to places like Hawaii and Australia. But some experts urge a change in strategy amid threats facing Taiwan.

events.title: Iranians caught between anger, fear and desire for change
events.summary: Amid the looming threat of a US attack, Iranians are still staging small-scale protests against the regime. But many have lost hope that change could ever come.

events.title: How Ukraine's war effort against Russia has evolved
events.summary: From traditional ground combat to survival in positions within the "kill zone" under constant drone surveillance, how has Ukraine's war against Russia changed over the past four years?

events.title: Security fears linger as Kenya set to open Somalia border
events.summary: Kenyan leader William Ruto wants more trade between the East African neighbors. But previous mooted border openings have failed and fears of Al-Shabab attacks remain.

events.title: Senegal PM proposes doubling jail terms for same-sex acts
events.summary: Senegal's prime minister has put forward legislation that would increase prison sentences for same-sex relations in Senegal. The move follows a series of arrests, including of public figures, under existing laws.

events.title: University cuts 'damaging Berlin's cultural standing'
events.summary: Students and teachers at one of Germany's most prestigious arts universities, the UdK, are devastated as vital arts courses have been hit by budget cuts. Many feel that the heart is being cut out of the city.

events.title: German union urges Turkish envoy summons after DW reporter arrested
events.summary: The German journalists' union has urged the Foreign Office to summon Turkey's ambassador. DW reporter Alican Uludag was arrested and placed in pretrial detention over a post that was critical of Turkey's government.

events.title: China shock: Rivalry tests Merz and German economy
events.summary: Chancellor Friedrich Merz is scrambling to defend German industry from the economic upheaval caused by intense rivalry from China. Momentum is building to impose new trade barriers to stop unfair trade practices.

events.title: Industrial AI: Germany's best chance to take on US, China?
events.summary: Germany is already harnessing AI for smarter production — with virtual factories, robot fleets and its newly launched Industrial AI Cloud. Can this edge overcome stagnation and let the country truly take on its rivals?

events.title: Germany news: Bundestag honors its late ex-president
events.summary: A state memorial ceremony has been held for Rita Süssmuth, who died this month. The gender pay gap in Germany is shrinking but still very much there, a study has shown.

events.title: Ukrainian resilience remains strong as war enters fifth year
events.summary: Russian attacks have made an already harsh winter even harder to endure for Ukrainians. And yet, after four years of war, most remain determined to tough it out.

events.title: UK ex-ambassador Mandelson released on bail in Epstein probe
events.summary: London police arrested former UK ambassador to the United States Peter Mandelson over his ties to late financier and convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. Mandelson was later released on bail.

events.title: Ukraine updates: 'Ukraine's fate is our fate' says Merz
events.summary: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz was amongst the European leaders marking the fourth anniversary of Russia's invasion. Ukraine's President Zelenskyy said Putin is still far from achieving his goals.

events.title: EU freezes US trade deal after Supreme Court tariff ruling
events.summary: European officials are asking the US for clarity on Donald Trump's new 15% tariff before they can move ahead with the deal.

events.title: Berlinale faces difficult balancing act in polarized Gaza debate
events.summary: A Palestinian award-winner's accusation that Germany has supported genocide sparked political after the closing gala, while others criticized the festival's attempts to remain neutral on Gaza.

events.title: World's first virtual minister in court in Albania
events.summary: Last fall, Albanian PM Edi Rama presented the world's first virtual minister, "Diella." Actor Anila Bisha says she never gave her consent for her voice and image to be used for the avatar and has filed a lawsuit.

events.title: NASA's Artemis II moon rocket back to the hangar
events.summary: A series of fueling issues has delayed the much-anticipated launch of NASA's Artemis II moon mission, the first to carry astronauts since the Apollo moon landings. The Space Launch System rocket is grounded until April.

events.title: China cashes in on clean energy as Trump clings to coal
events.summary: The Trump administration has rolled back environmental protections and blocked green energy development, China is forging ahead.

events.title: Germany weighs China risks in new trade era
events.summary: Chancellor Friedrich Merz is traveling to China for a belated inaugural visit. A lot is at stake as Germany is in search of global partners after the US has relinquished much of its longstanding role.

events.title: Do not inhale! How wildfire smoke 'affects the whole body'
events.summary: Wildfires destroy lives and livelihoods. But survivors and firefighters also suffer long-term harm to their health. A growing body of research suggests particulate matter (PM2.5) in wildfire smoke is a major culprit.

events.title: Italy: Remains of St. Francis displayed in Assisi
events.summary: Nearly 400,000 people pre-registered to see the bones of St. Francis of Assisi in the hilltop town in Italy's Umbria. The remains of Italy's patron saint date back to the 13th century.

events.title: Winter Olympics closing ceremony draws curtain on Games
events.summary: A distinctly Italian mix of opera, dance and DJs was mixed with a few last gold medals as Italy passed the Winter Olympic flame to France. Here's how it happened.

events.title: Germany: Protests against AfD events in Dortmund, Düsseldorf
events.summary: Over 3,000 people protested against the attendance of AfD politician Björn Höcke at a party event at Dortmund city hall on Sunday. An even bigger protest is expected in nearby Düsseldorf on Monday.

events.title: Has Donald Trump lost his most powerful tariff weapon?
events.summary: The US Supreme Court decision on tariffs has upended the central plank of President Donald Trump's economic and foreign policy. Will this lead to a change of course, or will Trump double down?

events.title: Trump tariffs: 'A deal is a deal,' EU insists
events.summary: The EU's executive insisted that "a deal is a deal" after US President Donald Trump said he was raising a global 10% tariff to 15% in response to the US Supreme Court blocking many of his emergency tariffs.

events.title: Germans approve of democracy but say it doesn't work well
events.summary: Democracy is indispensable, according to most respondents to the new "Germany Monitor 2025" survey. However, many say it is functioning less well than in the past, and rapid change is causing great uncertainty.

events.title: KLA veteran: 'Life is hard in Kosovo but we are free.'
events.summary: Gezim Haxhimusa fought in the Kosovo Liberation Army (KLA). This month, he celebrated independence day by protesting against a trial in The Hague. Four KLA leaders are in the dock for war crimes.

events.title: A Ukrainian soldier's story: Fading hope on the front line after four years of fighting
events.summary: DW correspondent Kostiantyn Honcharov joined the Ukrainian army in 2022. He describes the grim front-line situation after four years of fighting.

events.title: Berlinale: 'Yellow Letters' wins the Golden Bear award
events.summary: The political drama by Oscar nominee Ilker Catak took the top award at the Berlin International Film Festival.

events.title: Trump tariffs: EU grapples with fallout of US court ruling
events.summary: European leaders and businesses have responded to the US Supreme Court's decision to rule many of US President Donald Trump's tariffs illegal with both cautious optimism and deep uncertainty.

events.title: 1916: The bloody battle of Verdun
events.summary: The small, French town was the site of one of the bloodiest chapters of World War I, where German and French soldiers battled for 300 days — with neither side emerging victorious.

events.title: Ukraine strikes missile plant deep inside Russia
events.summary: The Votkinsk factory, that produces ballistic missiles, is more than 1,400 kilometers (870 miles) from Ukraine.

events.title: Giant tortoises reintroduced to a Galapagos island
events.summary: Ecuador released 158 juveniles in the first phase of an ambitious rewilding effort at the World Heritage Site.

events.title: French rally for slain far-right activist Quentin Deranque
events.summary: Thousands have marched in Lyon to honor Quentin Deranque, a far-right activist who was fatally beaten by a group of attackers during a protest against the hard-left France Unbowed (LFI) party.

events.title: Germany news: Merz rallies base at Stuttgart CDU conference
events.summary: The second day of the conference saw the party vote on dozens of proposals. Federal members came out strong against sugar taxes, call-in sick days, Muslim facial coverings, relaxed debt limits and much more. Follow DW.

events.title: No reckoning over ethnic cleansing of Bulgaria's Turks
events.summary: Bulgaria's Turkish community, descendants of Ottoman settlers, suffered severe persecution under the communist regime. Yet little has been done to address the injustice.

events.title: Germany cuts funding for integration of refugees
events.summary: The German Interior Ministry is restricting access to voluntary integration courses for immigrants, citing budget constraints. Many critics consider this a disastrous decision.

events.title: Hungary threatens veto of €90 billion EU loan to Ukraine
events.summary: After having agreed to provide Ukraine a €90 billion EU loan package, officials in Budapest have said on Friday they plan to veto the deal unless Russian oil starts flowing back to Hungary.

events.title: Belarus opposition figure urges EU dialogue with Lukashenko
events.summary: Maria Kolesnikova called on European leaders to reopen diplomatic channels with Alexander Lukashenko. She said such a move seemed the only way to ease the plight of political prisoners and their families.

events.title: Trump tariffs struck down: What's his plan now?
events.summary: The US Supreme Court has ruled that most of the president's tariffs are unconstitutional because of how he implemented them. But the administration is prepared to reinstate them, starting with a 10% temporary tariff.

events.title: Germany: Unreliable childcare forces parents into part-time
events.summary: Chancellor Merz has been calling on Germans to work more. This is practically impossible for many working parents as childcare centers battle with staff shortages and reduced operating hours.

events.title: Mercury fallout: What coal emissions do to people
events.summary: Coal-fired power plants are a major source of mercury contamination for people and the environment. Here's what you need to know.

events.title: Winter Olympics 2026: The lasting impressions
events.summary: Milan Cortina will be remembered for the performances of a Norwegian superstar and a Ukrainian skeleton racer's "helmet of remembrance."

events.title: Ukraine to boycott Paralympics opening over Russian flag decision
events.summary: Ukrainian competitors will boycott the March 6 Paralympics opening ceremony in Verona over the decision to allow some Russian and Belarusian athletes to compete under their national flags. Follow DW for more.

events.title: China overtakes US to become Germany's top trading partner
events.summary: China replaces US as Germany's top trading partner, reclaiming a position it held from 2016 to 2023. German Chancellor Friedrich Merz is set to visit China next week.

events.title: Weaned off Putin's gas, Europe now addicted to US LNG
events.summary: The EU is set to cut off Russian gas supplies in 2027. However, its promise to diversify and transition to renewables is under threat as LNG shipped from the US floods the bloc.

events.title: Nearly 2 million highly educated Germans at risk of poverty
events.summary: The figures indicate that although more people earned advanced qualifications, many did not secure well-paid jobs.

events.title: Austria: Snowstorm leaves at least 5 dead
events.summary: A snowstorm dumped a heavy layer of snow across parts of Austria overnight into Friday. The storm left four dead at ski resorts, while another person was crushed by a snowplow.

events.title: Germany news: CDU re-elects Chancellor Merz as party leader
events.summary: Chancellor Friedrich Merz accused the far-right AfD of only serving its "own interests" during a CDU party conference speech. Former Chancellor Angela Merkel was welcomed as a special guest at the Stuttgart event.

events.title: Far-right push clouds Lagarde's ECB future — Why it matters
events.summary: ECB chief Christine Lagarde insists she’ll complete her term, despite reports of an early exit to influence the French election. DW asks whether Europe must better shield its institutions from a rising far right.

events.title: 'Remarkable' new cat cancer genome could benefit humans
events.summary: International team uncovers gene mutations that cause rare and aggressive cancer in both cats and humans. Their findings could provide a path to treatments for both species.

events.title: Brazil's soy giants clear way for deforestation
events.summary: For almost two decades, Brazil's largest soy producers guaranteed their products did not come from land cleared in the Amazon rainforest. Now, all bets are off.

events.title: Germany's far-right AfD party faces widening scandal
events.summary: Turmoil has engulfed the far-right Alternative for Germany party (AfD). Allegations of nepotism and weak leadership are circulating, and influential officials warn the party is jeopardizing its election prospects.

events.title: Skimo: What you need to know about the newest Olympic sport
events.summary: Ski mountaineering is making its Olympic debut at the Winter Games in Italy. What is this sport all about?

events.title: Charli xcx spoofs herself in 'The Moment'
events.summary: She couldn't identify with the current trend of concert films, so British pop star Charli xcx flipped the form on a traditional genre with her new mockumentary.

events.title: Will Franco‑German differences sink €100bn fighter jet plan?
events.summary: Reports suggest the long-planned Franco-German FCAS air defense project is near collapse. In an exclusive interview with DW, Airbus Defence CEO Michael Schoellhorn says it needs to be restructured to survive.

events.title: Nationality at the Olympics: Does it matter?
events.summary: When athletes born in one place compete for another, a conversation around nationality and identity soon follows. But what does it mean?

events.title: State elections could spell doom for Germany's oldest party
events.summary: The Social Democrats were once a "big tent" party, with the support of almost half of Germany's electorate. Now, the SPD is fighting for relevance. This year, five state elections could spell trouble for the party.

events.title: India AI summit: Brazil's Lula lands, US giants tout plans
events.summary: Brazil's President Lula da Silva has arrived in New Delhi, while Google and Nvidia hail Indian expansion plans. Meanwhile, China felt the sting of intellectual property appropriation for once in a robot dog scandal.

events.title: Why a German shipping deal alarms Israel's government
events.summary: Hapag-Lloyd's deal to buy a major Israeli shipping company is colliding with national-security red lines. Critics say the purchase could expose critical infrastructure at a volatile moment in the Middle East.

events.title: Berlinale: Women from Iran, Afghanistan debut bold films
events.summary: These two female filmmakers express the injustice they've experienced in their home countries in contrasting genres: a romantic comedy — and a nightmarish drama.

events.title: From boom to burden: How overtourism hit European cities
events.summary: Many destinations are groaning under the strain of vacationers. So what turns certain places into tourist magnets? It isn't just the famous landmarks.

events.title: For a healthy break, don't check your ex's social media
events.summary: It feels harmless to peek at an ex’s posts on social media. But studies show that repeated checking can intensify heartbreak, prolong longing and slow emotional recovery.

events.title: Banana farm pesticides back in focus after sterility ruling
events.summary: A French court has rejected a compensation claim against US multinationals by Nicaraguan farm workers poisoned by the pesticide Nemagon. Farmers worldwide still rely on noxious chemicals, often exported from the EU.

events.title: Shein faces EU investigation over products, design features
events.summary: EU regulators are investigating Shein on suspicion that it has not done enough to limit the sale of illegal products and to protect consumers from allegedly addictive design features on the platform.

events.title: Russian and Belarussian flags to return at 2026 Paralympics
events.summary: The International Paralympic Committee has granted six wildcard spots to Russia and four to Belarus for the upcoming Winter Games. The athletes will not be required to participate under a neutral flag.

events.title: Italy enjoy historic Winter Games: Is home advantage real?
events.summary: Italy's athletes have won a record 25 medals at the 2026 Winter Olympics. How much of their success is because they are competing on home snow?

events.title: Nigeria investigates Temu for possible data privacy breaches
events.summary: Nigeria's data watchdog has opened an investigation into Chinese online retail discounter Temu, on suspicion of violations of data law. The company is facing mounting scrutiny amid its global expansion.

events.title: Book by mass rape survivor Gisele Pelicot tells her story
events.summary: She refuses to be a victim: Having survived years of assaults orchestrated by her husband while she was drugged unconscious, Pelicot chronicles in "A Hymn to Life" her path back to life.

events.title: Lower Saxony: AfD state chapter designated extremist group
events.summary: The state intelligence agency for Lower Saxony has upgraded the state chapter of Alternative for Germany (AfD) party to a "surveillance object of considerable import." This gives investigators more monitoring options.

events.title: Germany's governing CDU eyes reforms at party conference
events.summary: Germany is grappling with social reforms and so are the Christian Democrats (CDU). Their party conference will focus on welfare policy and state elections, as former Chancellor Angela Merkel makes a long-awaited return.

events.title: Why is the Strait of Hormuz off Iran so crucial?
events.summary: The Strait of Hormuz is considered the world's most critical chokepoint for the oil trade. Iran has repeatedly threatened to block the waterway and last week partially closed it for military drills.

events.title: Germany inflation rises 2.1% at start of 2026
events.summary: Increases in food and fuel prices were the main drivers of inflation in Germany, new statistics confirmed.

events.title: The frog poison that killed Alexei Navalny likely lab-made
events.summary: A rare frog poison has been named as the cause of Russian democracy fighter Alexei Navalny's 2024 death. But it's unlikely to have come from a frog.

events.title: 'Apocalypse Now' actor Robert Duvall dies aged 95
events.summary: Robert Duvall won an Oscar for "Tender Mercies" and earned nominations for classics including "The Godfather," "Apocalypse Now," and "The Great Santini."

events.title: Obama clarifies his 'they're real' podcast comment on aliens
events.summary: Barack Obama caused an online stir by telling a podcaster aliens were "real," albeit stressing he had not seen any as US president. He's since clarified that he believes they exist, rather than having special knowledge.

events.title: How Epstein got so rich
events.summary: How did the well-connected financier and convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein amass such great wealth?

events.title: 2026 Year of the Horse: Humans and horses go way back
events.summary: Highly valued in diverse cultures, the horse gallops to pole position in the Chinese zodiac. Famous horse babies include Nelson Mandela and Jackie Chan.

events.title: Why we're becoming disconnected from nature
events.summary: Scientists report a rise in nature anxiety, or biophobia, warning that humans are losing touch with the natural world. Here's how to reconnect.

events.title: Germany news: Right-wing violence rises in 2025
events.summary: Germany has recorded more cases of violent right-wing crime in 2025 than the previous year. The Berlin Film Festival has defended itself amid a controversy on its stance toward politics.

events.title: As the telephone turns 150, are we hanging up on phone calls?
events.summary: Today, 150 years after the invention of the telephone, it has never been easier to call someone. But in some ways, and for some people, picking up the phone is still a very hard thing to do.

events.title: AI-fueled chip shortage drives up smartphone prices
events.summary: The era of cheap data storage is ending. Artificial intelligence is pushing chip prices higher and exacerbating supply shortages. Anyone buying a new smartphone in 2026 should brace for higher prices.

events.title: Does this chemical really make you fall in love?
events.summary: For years, oxytocin was thought of as the love drug: enhancing trust and emotional connection. But the truth is more complex.

events.title: Germany's big builds: Why delays and cost overruns are so common
events.summary: Major construction projects are rarely finished on time and usually cost much more than expected. What ever happened to German efficiency?

events.title: Is Netflix making us stupid?
events.summary: Netflix is increasingly designing films and series for distracted, second-screen viewers. DW's Scott Roxborough asks what it means for storytelling, visual language and the future of cinema as an art form.

events.title: Vladislav Heraskevych's Olympic helmet appeal dismissed
events.summary: The skeleton racer failed in his bid to compete at the Winter Games. Vladislav Heraskevych lost an appeal to the CAS after the IOC banned him from competing with a helmet featuring the names of killed Ukrainian athletes.

events.title: Germany: Security alert halts flights at Cologne/Bonn airport
events.summary: Cologne/Bonn Airport temporarily suspended outgoing passenger processing after police cleared the security area as a precaution. The alert, which has been lifted, followed the introduction of new screening technology.

events.title: Trump drops key US climate rule, swaps health for cheap cars
events.summary: The US has revoked what's known as the endangerment finding, a scientific finding central to US climate actions, to boost cheaper, gas-powered cars. Experts say the shift comes at a fragile point for the warming planet.

events.title: Germany braces for more strikes in 2026
events.summary: This year has already seen considerable industrial action and labor disputes in Germany. More strikes are expected in the aviation, train travel and chemicals industries.

events.title: Should the Berlinale film festival 'stay out of politics’?
events.summary: Asked if the Berlin International Film Festival should take a stand on Gaza, jury president Wim Wenders said it must "stay out of politics." Not everyone agrees.

events.title: France, Germany signal unity at EU's Belgium castle retreat
events.summary: Emmanuel Macron and Friedrich Merz greeted the press together on arrival at the Alden Biesen Castle, with Macron saying they shared a "sense of urgency" on economic reform. But the two may clash on the way forward.

events.title: Germany's new plans to tackle spiralling rents
events.summary: Tenants in big cities like Berlin are being exploited by the use of legal loopholes to circumvent rent control laws. The government is now planning to introduce new rules for furnished and short-term rentals.

events.title: How a heckled Canadian became Germany's Olympic hockey coach
events.summary: Harold Kreis is embarking on his first Olympic Games as coach of the German men's ice hockey team. Now a legend of the game in his adopted homeland, he wasn't welcomed by all when he first arrived from Canada.

events.title: First German politician enters Gaza since October 7 attack
events.summary: The speaker of the Bundestag, Julia Klöckner, entered as far as the so-called "Yellow Line" of predominantly Israeli control in Gaza. She held no talks with Palestinians, prompting some criticism at home.

events.title: 'Threat to world peace': How Germans see the US now
events.summary: Back in 2016, German trust in the United States was at all-time high. Today the situation could not be more different. This is mostly due to US President Donald Trump and his unpredictable policies.

events.title: Epstein files implicate Germany's Deutsche Bank
events.summary: The latest release of Epstein files show the late financier and convicted sex offender had up to 40 accounts with Deutsche Bank.

events.title: Ukraine athlete Heraskevych: 'My Olympic moment was stolen'
events.summary: Ukrainian skeleton athlete Vladyslav Heraskevych was disqualified from the Winter Games over his 'helmet of remembrance.' He has now appealed his case to the Court of Administation for Sport.

events.title: Olympics: Ukrainian athlete banned over 'political' helmet
events.summary: The IOC has disqualified Ukrainian skeleton racer Vladyslav Heraskevych for wearing a helmet that features images of Ukrainian athletes killed during Russia's war on Ukraine.

events.title: Germany: Tesla charges trade union member in IG Metall fight
events.summary: Tesla's German factory in Grünheide is pressing charges against an external trade union member. The company said he was caught recording a confidential meeting without permission; the IG Metall union called this a lie.

events.title: Greenland's Olympic siblings keen to help protect homeland
events.summary: Sondre and Ukaleq Slettemark usually make up Greenland's biathlon team, despite a lack of facilities. But they are competing for Denmark at the Winter Olympics and, unlike Donald Trump, they want it to stay that way.

events.title: Berlinale film festival blends politics, pop culture
events.summary: An Afghan feature opens the Berlin International Film Festival, while stars including Pamela Anderson, Ethan Hawke and John Turturro are expected on the red carpet.

events.title: Berlinale 2026 honors Michelle Yeoh, icon of cinema
events.summary: Recognized with the Honorary Golden Bear in Berlin, the Malaysian actor became the first Asian woman to receive an Oscar, in 2023 for her role in "Everything Everywhere All at Once."

events.title: Olympics T-shirt marking 1936 Berlin Games raises eyebrows
events.summary: T-shirts on the Olympics online store commemorating past venues include one for the 1936 Games in Berlin. Nazi Germany hosted both the Winter and Summer Olympics that year, as it was starting to ramp up its repression.

events.title: Samer Tawk: From intensive care to Winter Olympic return
events.summary: In 2018, Samer Tawk became the first athlete to represent Lebanon in cross-country skiing at the Winter Olympics. A year later, he was lying in a hospital bed wondering if he would ever walk again.

events.title: The German Olympic ski jump winner with a fear of heights
events.summary: German ski jumper Philipp Raimund hasn't won a single World Cup event. That's just part of what makes his Olympic gold medal performance so incredible.

events.title: Italy: Rai sports staff to strike over Olympic opening farce
events.summary: RaiSport's director gave himself the announcer's job for the Winter Olympics opening ceremony and then proceeded to botch it. Staff have announced a strike in protest to begin once the Games are finished.

events.title: IOC bars Ukrainian skeleton racer from wearing memorial helmet at Olympics
events.summary: Ukraine's bid to let skeleton racer Vladyslav Heraskevych use a helmet honoring athletes killed in the war with Russia has been rejected by the International Olympic Committee.

events.title: Corruption watchdog reports increase in global graft
events.summary: Once seen as anti-graft strongholds, the US, UK, Canada and Sweden are slipping into decline due to a lack of political leadership, Transparency International's Corruption Perception Index has revealed.

events.title: Germany's gas reserves face crucial energy supply test
events.summary: The country's stockpiles have dropped to about 30% amid a spell of severe cold. Will supplies hold up?

events.title: Nature: the economy's secret lifeline?
events.summary: New global research exposes the business–nature link we can’t afford to ignore — plus the playbook for fixing it.

events.title: Super Bowl 2026: Seattle Seahawks beat New England Patriots
events.summary: The Seattle Seahawks have defeated the New England Patriots in the NFL's showpiece event, with Puerto Rican singer Bad Bunny making history by performing the halftime show in Spanish.

events.title: Fake Berlin Wall fragments on sale as souvenirs?
events.summary: It's been nearly 40 years since the fall of the Berlin Wall but you can still buy pieces of it in the German capital as souvenirs. Are they the real deal?

events.title: Why scientists warn of privately funded geoengineering
events.summary: As the climate crisis intensifies, interest in solar engineering is increasing, including among private companies and investors. But the technique is controversial and lacks regulation.

events.title: How the Epstein-Barr virus triggers MS in some people
events.summary: Multiple sclerosis is also caused by a virus carried by almost all humans. A new study provides an explanation as to why only certain people develop the disease. This also opens up the possibility of a treatment.

events.title: 2026 Winter Olympics opening ceremony — as it happened
events.summary: The 2026 Winter Olympics opening ceremony is finally here. DW followed the official opening to the 25th edition of the games live in Milan.

events.title: Women's Bundesliga dispute shows no sign of ending
events.summary: The future of women’s football in Germany remains in limbo, with the country’s top league and its association (DFB) wrestling for control. Germany's top clubs are refusing to work with the DFB, at least for now.

events.title: China grows while Europe slows in South American EV market
events.summary: China's electric carmakers are rapidly expanding across South America as Europe hesitates with trade liberalization. From Brazil to Argentina, a high-stakes battle is unfolding for the region's future auto market.

events.title: Cycle syncing exercise could optimize results for women
events.summary: Women in gyms hear it all the time: lift heavy in some weeks, go lighter in others, depending on your menstrual cycle — because your hormones affect your strength. But is it backed by science?

events.title: The fight for American football in Europe
events.summary: After the fall of the European League of Football, two rival organizations have emerged to fill the gap. Can they succeed where others, including the NFL, failed?

events.title: Trump to be exposed at Cologne Carnival's Rose Monday parade
events.summary: Donald Trump, Friedrich Merz and Emmanuel Macron are all targets of satirical floats at this year's Rose Monday Parade in Cologne. But Vladimir Putin will be spared — and there is a reason for that.

events.title: How US Project Vault challenges China's rare-earth dominance
events.summary: Donald Trump's Project Vault seeks to secure US access to rare earth minerals vital for advanced tech and clean energy. The EU wants a minerals alliance with Washington, but can they really shift China's outsized lead?

events.title: World Cancer Day: Smoking, infections and alcohol cause 4 in 10 preventable cancer cases
events.summary: A new WHO study suggests that over 7 million cases of cancer in 2022 were preventable. Nearly 40% of all the cases that year were linked to modifiable risk factors — behavioral and environmental factors we can change.

events.title: Tiny dinosaur fossil could provide evolutionary clues: study
events.summary: Scientists have said fossils of a small newly discovered dinosaur found in Spain could change ideas on the evolution of ornithopods.

events.title: Tackling forever chemicals could save money and our health
events.summary: Critics say a new UK plan to tackle forever chemicals does not match proposed measures in the EU. As European governments try to deal with the growing PFAS pollution, cleaning it up could cost up to €1.7 trillion.

events.title: Vienna swaps parking for green space
events.summary: Conscious of reaching climate goals and strapped for space, some cities are reconsidering how much they dedicate to parking. Austria's capital, Vienna, is streets ahead.

events.title: Trump's Greenland 'piece of ice' remark echoes history
events.summary: Donald Trump's description of Greenland echoes a colonial pattern in which powerful states have dismissed sparsely populated land, ignoring Indigenous ties.

events.title: The hidden money behind deep-sea mining
events.summary: A DW investigation traces the hidden financial web behind deep-sea mining — an industry scientists say remains poorly understood, yet capable of causing irreversible harm to oceans worldwide.

events.title: An undying trend: How vampires like those in 'Sinners' hold a mirror to society
events.summary: As the horror movie "Sinners" stands poised to sweep the Oscars, we take a look at how and why the vampire genre has long captivated audiences — from folklore to film. Is this trend truly immortal?

events.title: Canadian actress Catherine O'Hara dies at 71
events.summary: Catherine O'Hara was famous for starring roles in the series "Schitt's Creek" and the "Home Alone" movies. She got her start with the Second City Toronto comedy troupe in the 1970s before her career in Hollywood.

events.title: Trial against German Carnival satirist Tilly underway in Russia
events.summary: Jacques Tilly's Carnival floats mocking Vladimir Putin have landed him before a Moscow court. As the trial drags on, the Dusseldorf-based satirist has denounced the charges as an assault on freedom of expression.

events.title: Why fans are obsessed with 'Bridgerton'
events.summary: Opulent romance, a diverse cast and plotlines that meld fairytales with a modern zeitgeist: "Bridgerton" has redefined the period-piece genre.

events.title: Heating with air conditioning saves on cost and cuts CO2
events.summary: From Japan to China and the US to Scandinavia, heating with air conditioning has long been standard practice. But now warming homes with AC is catching on in other parts of the world.

events.title: Arctic scientists 'feel pretty uncomfortable' on Greenland
events.summary: Science in the Arctic — and Greenland — is on the frontline of pressing challenges facing humanity, like climate change and genetics. Some researchers worry international collaboration is at risk.

events.title: Environmental crises add to Iran's mounting troubles
events.summary: Widespread discontent in Iran has sent millions of protesters into the streets. Poor environmental planning embodies one of the government's most existential vulnerabilities.

events.title: Plastic emissions could double health damage by 2040
events.summary: Plastic pollution could double its harm to human health in the coming decades if current production trends continue, according to a new study that links rising risks directly to the manufacture of new plastics.

events.title: Paris Agreement 10 years on: More wins than you may realize
events.summary: Major emitter the US has officially left the Paris Agreement and global emissions keep rising a decade on from the deal. Yet renewables' growth shows climate action can work. Here's what's been done and what's missing.

events.title: PSG's Hakimi to face trial on rape charges
events.summary: Paris ⁠Saint-Germain ⁠defender Achraf Hakimi ⁠said that he will stand trial following a rape accusation made against him. The accusation stems from a February 2023 incident in which a then 24-year-old woman accused the Moroccan player of sexually assaulting her at his home outside of Paris. Hakimi has repeatedly denied any wrongdoing.

events.title: Germany's Merz to push for 'fair' economic competition on first visit to China
events.summary: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz touched down in China on Wednesday, beginning his inaugural visit to his country's largest trade partner and a high-tech rival as Europe's biggest economy struggles Merz said he would use the trip to push for “fair” economic competition with China.

events.title: Millions in Somalia at risk of severe hunger from drought, says UN
events.summary: Nearly 6.5 million people in Somalia are facing severe hunger as worsening drought, conflict and global aid cuts intensify the country’s humanitarian crisis, the federal government and UN agencies said Tuesday.

events.title: Senegal PM seeks 10-year prison terms for same-sex relations
events.summary: Senegal's Prime Minister Ousmane ⁠Sonko pushed on ​Tuesday for a draft law that would double the maximum prison term from ​five to 10 years for same-sex practices and other conduct deemed unnatural, part of a wider crackdown on LGBT people.

events.title: State of the Union address: Do Trump's claims on economy stand up?
events.summary: Donald Trump boasted in his State of the Union address on Tuesday that he had ushered in "the golden age of America," saying he had slowed inflation, driven the stock market to record heights, signed sweeping tax cuts and lowered drug prices. But, says Nicolas Véron, senior fellow at the Bruegel think tank, the true outlook for the American economy is far more uncertain.

events.title: Drama, spectacle and division as Trump delivers contentious State of the Union address
events.summary: US President Donald Trump boasted Tuesday of a "turnaround for the ages" in his State of the Union speech, seeking to reverse dismal polls and see off mounting challenges at home and abroad ahead of crucial midterm elections. It was also a speech marked by drama with the divisions rife in US politics and society on full display. At one moment as Trump praised his immigration enforcement, Democrat Ilhan Omar, who represents a Minneapolis US House district, shouted in his direction, "You have killed Americans!"

events.title: Trump’s 2026 State of Union address shows US politics ‘as divided as ever’
events.summary: President Donald Trump made “very little effort to reach across the aisle to Democrats” in his 2026 State of the Union speech, the longest in US history. He zeroed in on his “red meat issue, which is immigration,” sparking heckles at times from some Democrats, David Smith, The Guardian’s Washington DC bureau chief, tells FRANCE 24 shortly after the address.

events.title: Heckles, expulsion, cheers: Top moments from Trump’s State of the Union speech
events.summary: The 2026 State of the Union address was the longest in US history. While Donald Trump delivered the first such speech of his second presidential term, there were several moments of high drama as a sharply divided Congress watched before a television audience of millions. Here are five top moments.

events.title: Sri Lanka arrests ex-spy chief for ‘abetting’ 2019 Easter bombings
events.summary: Sri Lanks authorities on Wednesday arrested the country's former intelligence chief, Suresh Sally, for "conspiracy and aiding and abetting" the 2019 Easter bombings, which killed 279 people, according to an investigating officer. A whistleblower has claimed Sallay allowed the attack to proceed with the intention of influencing the 2019 presidential election.

events.title: Champions League: Bodo/Glimt make history by eliminating Inter Milan
events.summary: Norwegian side Bodo/Glimt made history by knocking 2025 finalist Inter Milan out of the Champions League on Tuesday.

events.title: Longest address in decades: Trump sets State of the Union record
events.summary:
US President Donald Trump delivered the longest-ever State of the Union address on Tuesday, beating Bill Clinton's 2000 record of one hour and 20 minutes.
 
Republican Trump also smashed his own 1 hour and 40 minute record for a presidential speech to Congress, which he set last March in an annual address that was not technically a State of the Union.

events.title: Trump claims Iran building missiles that could reach US targets
events.summary:
During his State of the Union address, US President Donald Trump said that Iran and its proxies have “spread nothing but terrorism, death and hate,” adding that its leaders have killed at least 32,000 protesters in recent weeks.
 
He also warned that Tehran has developed missiles that can threaten Europe and is working on missiles “that will soon reach” the US and is trying to rebuild its nuclear program.

events.title: Donald Trump welcomes US men’s hockey team during the State of the Union address
events.summary: Donald Trump welcomes US men’s hockey team during the State of the Union address

events.title: Brazil floods and landslides kill dozens after record rainfall
events.summary: Three firefighters recovered a man’s body from mud and rubble after landslides triggered by torrential rains killed at least 30 people in southeastern Brazil, authorities said Tuesday, with 39 still missing. Rivers burst their banks in Minas Gerais state, inundating Juiz de Fora and Uba. More than 200 people were rescued.

events.title: Trump threatens Iran in State of the Union speech, Tehran compares him to Goebbels
events.summary: President Donald Trump claimed during his 2026 State of the Union speech that Iran was developing missiles that can strike the US.  An Iranian foreign ministry spokesman on Wednesday dismissed the claim, comparing it to Nazi propagandist Joseph Goebbels’s “illusion of truth” quote: "Repeat a lie often enough and it becomes the truth”. Follow our liveblog for the latest updates.

events.title: UK to enforce electronic travel permit for visitors from 85 countries or face travel ban
events.summary: Visitors from 85 countries must obtain an electronic travel permit before arriving in Britain from Wednesday or risk being denied boarding, the interior ministry said. The Electronic Travel Authorisation, introduced in 2023, requires visa-exempt travellers to apply online and pay £16. Enforcement becomes mandatory from February 25.

events.title: Bodo/Glimt complete dream run with victory over Inter Milan in Champions League
events.summary: Norwegian side Bodo/Glimt reached the Champions League last 16 on Tuesday after a 2-1 win at Inter Milan secured a 5-2 aggregate victory, sealing the biggest result in the club’s history and setting up a tie with either Manchester City or Sporting Portugal.

events.title: Iran says deal with US 'within reach' ahead of talks in Geneva
events.summary: Iran’s Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi said Tuesday a deal to avert military confrontation with the United States was within reach, ahead of talks set to resume in Geneva. His remarks came as Tehran issued a muted warning to student protesters amid mounting US threats over Iran’s nuclear programme.

events.title: Trump 'now underwater on all top ten issues except border security', analyst says
events.summary: Speaking with FRANCE 24's Sharon Gaffney, Larry Sabato, Founder and Director of the University of Virginia Centre for Politics, explains that US President Donald Trump will be focused on maintaining his MAGA base ahead of the State of the Union address, stressing that Trump "has lost a great deal" of popularity since the inauguration and "on the ten top issues he is now underwater in every single one except border security".

events.title: How Russia has finetuned its disinformation campaign in 4 years of Ukraine war
events.summary: Four years into Russia’s full-scale invasion of Ukraine, Moscow has redoubled its efforts in disinformation warfare. Its methods have evolved, with more generative AI, more targeting of Ukraine’s allies, and increasing manipulation of real news stories. It’s therefore fitting that disinformation watchdog NewsGuard named a Russian tech bro, Yevgeny Shevchenko, its 2025 “Disinformer of the Year”.

events.title: South Africa secures release of more nationals lured to Ukraine war
events.summary: In tonight's edition, President Cyril Ramaphosa thanks his counterpart Vladimir Putin for helping to secure the return of 11 South Africans tricked into joining the Russia-Ukraine war. Also, the military spokesperson for the M23 rebel group is reportedly killed in an army drone strike in eastern DR Congo. And more than 6 million people are on the brink of famine in Somalia as the country is facing widespread drought.

events.title: German Chancellor seeks "right balance" in his first official visit to China
events.summary: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz is visiting China on a two-day trip starting Wednesday.  He's the latest in a string of Western leaders to try and seek new partnerships with the Asian giant in recent weeks, amid Donald Trump's trade war against the rest of the world.  It's a delicate balancing act for the German leader as the country's industry has been squeezed by competition from China. But first, we take stock of what four years of war have done to Ukraine's economy.

events.title: Putin's war weapons hiding in plain sight - in the English Channel
events.summary: In the English Channel, less than two hours by fishing boat from Dover, some of the most potent weapons in Russia's war on Ukraine are hiding in plain sight.

events.title: Meet the Ukrainian who swapped Wall Street for the frontline
events.summary: A medic who gave up a promising  Wall Street career to serve on the frontlines in Ukraine has told Sky News it was the "easiest decision she ever made".

events.title: Trump's three options for Iran
